result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Jay Anthony David was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: w/huber to be served in 48 hour increments to be on or before 3/3/17 from 8:00 pm on Friday to 8:00 pm on Sunday (as long as it totals 48 hours)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Jay Anthony David

records.addlTxt: DNA sample unless already done.  Not to own or possess any firearms.

Defendant, Kevin Jay Anthony David appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Deft has informed the state that he has decided to take the offer that the State had offered at the last hearing.  State explains why his last attorney was dismissed.  The jury is present along with the arresting officer.  Court questions the state.  Court questions the deft and informs the deft as the costs that have been incurred for this trial.  State explains why he did not remove the jury trial after hearing from his assistant.  Back on the record with this case at 8:42 am  Plea questionnaire reviewed. Deft enters a plea of no contest to the charge.  Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.
Court takes a break back on the record at 9:05 am.  Court informs the deft that the cost for bringing in the Jury is around $1000.00.    Court to call the jurors into the courtroom to dismiss.  Case recalled again at 9:08 am. Court informs the jurors as to what is going on.
Jurors are dismissed at 9:11 am  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Court take a break to review some paperwork and give the jail a call.  Back on the record at 10:10 am

Court orders:
  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.  
$500 for jury fee
20 Days jail w/huber to be served in 48 hr increments to be on or before 3/3/17 on or before 8:00 pm Friday to 8:00 pm Sunday. (as long as it totals 48 hours)
0 sentence credit

Defendant, Kevin Jay Anthony David appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Victim rights do not apply.  State motion to determine admissibility of Statements and Hearing on Admission of Prior Convictions.  State informs the court that they are withdrawing the motion to determine admissibility.  State makes agruements in regards to the motion on prior convictions.  State says the number should be 3.  Deft questions the court as to the purpose of that question.  Court explains the reason to the deft.  After court explains to the deft.  The deft agrees to the 3 priors. Court rules to grant the motion of the State on Admission of Prior convictions.  Court concludes the 2008 conviction is not relevent.  Deft brings up a issue in regards to statements that were made. State has no comment the Court made a decision in February.  Court informs the parties that this is a #1 trial for January 9, 2017.  Court informs the deft that we will begin at 8:30 am on  1/9/17.
for hearing on admission of Prior convictions for impeachment purposes relative to the defendant - state
to determine admissibility of statements - state
Motion hearing on December 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Kevin Jay Anthony David appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Court address the deft in regards to his attorney bill with the court.  Deft fills out paperwork to proceed to trial without an attorney.  Court reviews the waiver of right to attorney paperwork.  FVI  Deft has a few questions as to how a jury works.  Court gives the deft some information regarding the proceedings of a trial.  Court verifies the phone is correct for the deft.
